alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 25 at 2:10PM EST until November 29 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 10 inches possible. The highest totals are likely to occur over western and northern sections of the county. Keep in mind that snow amounts could change quickly over small distances. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph, producing significant blowing and drifting. * WHERE...Warren County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes on both Monday and Tuesday.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
